Class oracle.lang.NLS 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index  OWS Table of Contents

Class oracle.lang.NLS 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----oracle.lang.NLS
public class NLS
extends Object
This class provides the base support for Oracle NLS strings. Currently, only 7-bit ASCII is supported.

ASCII
Constant represents 7-bit ASCII character set

NLS2Unicode(byte[], char[], int, int, int, int)
Converts a NLS string to its Unicode equivalent.
NLSBufferSize(char[], int)
Determines the minimum number of bytes needed to store the NLS-equivalent of a Unicode string.
Unicode2NLS(char[], byte[], int, int, int, int)
Converts a Unicode string to its NLS equivalent.
currentCharSet()
Returns the current character set.
length(byte[], int, int)
Returns the length (character count) of a NLS string.
setCurrentCharSet(int)
Sets the current character set.

ASCII 
  public final static int ASCII
Constant represents 7-bit ASCII character set

NLSBufferSize 
  public static int NLSBufferSize(char str[],
                                  int charSet)
Determines the minimum number of bytes needed to store the NLS-equivalent of a Unicode string.
Parameters:
str - the source Unicode string
charSet - the target character set
Returns:
number of bytes needed
length 
  public static int length(byte str[],
                           int length,
                           int charSet)
Returns the length (character count) of a NLS string.
Parameters:
str - the NLS string
length - the length of this NLS String (number of bytes)
charSet - the character set of the NLS string
Returns:
the length of the NLS string
Unicode2NLS 
  public static int Unicode2NLS(char src[],
                                byte dst[],
                                int srcBegin,
                                int srcEnd,
                                int dstBegin,
                                int charSet)
Converts a Unicode string to its NLS equivalent.
Parameters:
src - the source Unicode string
dst - the target NLS string
srcBegin - begin copy at this offset in the source Unicode string
srcEnd - stop copy at this offset in the source Unicode string (exclusive)
dstBegin - offset into dst
charSet - the character set of the target NLS string
Returns:
length of NLS string (number of bytes)
NLS2Unicode 
  public static int NLS2Unicode(byte src[],
                                char dst[],
                                int srcBegin,
                                int srcEnd,
                                int dstBegin,
                                int charSet)
Converts a NLS string to its Unicode equivalent.
Parameters:
src - the source NLS string
dst - the target Unicode string
srcBegin - begin copy at this offset in the source NLS string
srcEnd - stop copy at this offset in the source NLS string (exclusive)
dstBegin - offset into dst
charSet - the character set of the source NLS string
Returns:
length of NLS string (number of bytes)
currentCharSet 
  public static int currentCharSet()
Returns the current character set.
setCurrentCharSet 
  public static synchronized void setCurrentCharSet(int charSet)
Sets the current character set. The default character set is 7-bit ASCII.
Parameters:
charSet - the character set to set to
